page.title: 15EQUIPMENT FOR HOME AND FARM
page.content: Our parents have a lot more equipment to help than our grandparents had. In all our homes we have washing machines. Most of them are automatic, but some are twin-tub with a separate part for washing and drying. Everyone has a vacuum cleaner to clean the floor. All homes have a refrigerator to keep food cool, and a freezer to keep food cold for a long time. In the kitchen there are many electrical appliances, such as toasters, kettles, sandwich toasters, and food mixers. All farms have at least one tractor now. Others machines are worked from them, such as mowers, and balers for making the hay into bales. The newest machine is a round baler which makes big bales. These are carried around by a special spike fitted to the front of the tractor. There are machines for spraying and muck spreading.
